New Records: David Warner became the second highest run-scorer in the 2023 ODI World Cup, surpassing Adam Gilchrist with 1220 runs.
Warner's 163 off 124 balls is the fifth highest score in his ODI career.
Warner and Mitch Marsh's 259-run partnership is the fourth highest in Australia's ODI history
Key Match Events: David Warner scored 163 off 124 balls, including 14 fours and nine sixes.
Australia won the match by 62 runs after Pakistan were all out for 259 in 48.5 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: David Warner stated he doesn't focus on his success against specific teams, but his form against Pakistan has been consistent.
Warner mentioned that Shaheen Shah Afridi is a challenging bowler to face due to his pace and swing.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.
Warner's strike rate of 115.29 in 2023 is the highest in his career.
Australia's World Cup standings showed them in third place after the match.
